longDef.en: very, extremely, or to such a degree

examples.en: The house is so beautiful.
examples.cn: 这房子太漂亮了！

examples.en: Thank you for being so patient.
examples.cn: 谢谢你这么耐心。

examples.en: Don't be so stupid!
examples.cn: 不要这么傻了！

examples.en: I didn't know she had so many children!
examples.cn: 我不知道她有这么多孩子！

examples.en: You can only do so much to help (= there is a limit to how much you can help).
examples.cn: 你只能帮忙到这个地步。

examples.en: She's ever so kind and nice.
examples.cn: 她向来这样和蔼可亲。

examples.en: I'm so tired (that) I could sleep in this chair!
examples.cn: 我太累了，连坐在这椅子上都能睡着！

examples.en: I'm not so desperate as to agree to that.
examples.cn: 我并不急着非同意不可。

examples.en: The word itself is so rare as to be almost obsolete.
examples.cn: 这个词本身就十分罕见，几乎要被淘汰了。

longDef.en: used before a noun or before "not" to emphasize what is being said
longDef.cn: （用在名词或 not 前表示强调）

examples.en: Don't wear that - it's so last year (= it was fashionable last year but not now).
examples.cn: 别穿那个了——去年才流行那个呢，现在早过时了。

examples.en: I'm sorry, but she is so not a size 10 (= she is very much larger than a size 10).
examples.cn: 对不起，但适合她的尺码绝对要比10号大很多。

longDef.en: used at the end of a sentence to mean to a very great degree

examples.en: Is that why you hate him so?
examples.cn: 这就是你如此痛恨他的原因吗？

examples.en: You worry so!
examples.cn: 你太多虑了！

longDef.en: used usually before the verbs "have", "be", or "do", and other auxiliary verbs to express the meaning "in the same way" or "in a similar way"
longDef.cn: （通常用于 have，be，do 等助动词前）同样，像这样

examples.en: "I've got an enormous amount of work to do." "So have I."
examples.cn: “我有很多很多工作要做。”“我也一样。”

examples.en: "I'm allergic to nuts." "So is my brother."
examples.cn: “我对坚果过敏。”“我弟弟也是。”

examples.en: Neil left just after midnight and so did Roz.
examples.cn: 尼尔午夜刚过就走了，罗兹也走了。

examples.en: Just as you like to have a night out with the lads, so I like to go out with the girls now and again.
examples.cn: 就像你喜欢和小伙子晚上出去一样，我偶尔也喜欢和女孩子一起出去。

longDef.en: used to avoid repeating a phrase mentioned earlier
longDef.cn: （用于代替先前提到的短语以避免重复）这样，如此

examples.en: "I hope they stay together." "I hope so too."
examples.cn: “我希望他们在一起。”“我也希望如此。”

examples.en: "Do you think he's upset?" "I don't think so."
examples.cn: “你认为他不高兴了吗？”“我想没有。”

examples.en: James is coming tonight, or so he said.
examples.cn: 詹姆斯今晚要来，至少他是这么说的。

longDef.en: used to say that a situation mentioned earlier is correct or true

examples.en: "Is it true that we're not getting a pay increase this year?" "I'm afraid so."
examples.cn: “我们今年真的不会加薪吗？”“恐怕是这样的。”

examples.en: "Anthony and Mia don't get along very well." "Is that so?"
examples.cn: “安东尼和米娅相处得不怎么好。”“真是那样吗？”

examples.en: "The forecast says it might rain." "If so, we'll have the party inside."
examples.cn: “天气预报说可能要下雨。”“如果真是那样的话，我们就在室内聚会。”

longDef.en: used to say that a fact that has just been stated is certainly true

examples.en: "My eyes are slightly different colours." "So they are."
examples.cn: “我两眼的颜色略有差别。”“的确如此。”

examples.en: "That's her brother - he looks like James Dean." "So he does."
examples.cn: “那是她弟弟——看上去像詹姆斯•迪恩。”“的确如此。”

longDef.en: used instead of repeating an adjective that has already been mentioned
longDef.cn: （用于代替已提到过的形容词以避免重复）

examples.en: She's reasonable to work with - more so than I was led to believe.
examples.cn: 她是个能与之共事的人——比人们告诉我的要好。

examples.en: He's fairly bright - well, certainly more so than his brother.
examples.cn: 他挺聪明的——嗯，绝对比他弟弟聪明。

longDef.en: used, especially by children, to argue against a negative statement

examples.en: "You didn't even see the movie." "I did so!"
examples.cn: “你根本没有看过这部电影。”“我就是看过！”

longDef.en: to act in the way mentioned

examples.en: Parents must take responsibility for their children. Failure to do so could mean a fine or a jail sentence.
examples.cn: 父母必须为他们的子女负责，如果不这样的话可能意味着罚款或监禁。

longDef.en: in this way, or like this

examples.en: The pillars, which are outside the building, are so placed in order to provide the maximum space inside.
examples.cn: 建筑物外面的柱子如此排列是为了能提供最大的室内空间。

examples.en: I've so arranged my trip that I'll be home on Friday night.
examples.cn: 我这样安排自己的旅程就能在星期五晚上到家。

longDef.en: used when you are showing how something is done

examples.en: Just fold this piece of paper back, so, and make a crease here.
examples.cn: 把这张纸反折，就这样，在这儿折一条痕。

examples.en: Gently fold in the eggs like so.
examples.cn: 就这样轻轻拌入鸡蛋。

longDef.en: used when you are representing the size of something

examples.en: "How tall is he next to you?" "Oh, about so big," she said, indicating the level of her neck.
examples.cn: “他到你哪儿？”“哦，大约这么高。”她在自己的脖子上比划了一下说道。

examples.en: "The table that I liked best was about so wide," she said, holding her arms out a metre and a half.
examples.cn: “我最喜欢的桌子大约有这么宽。”她说着，张开双臂至一米半的间距。

longDef.en: used at the beginning of a sentence to connect it with something that has been said or has happened previously
longDef.cn: （放在句首，表示和已说过或已发生过的事相联系）如此，这样，那么

examples.en: So, there I was standing at the edge of the road with only my underwear on ...
examples.cn: 就这样，我站在路边，只穿着内衣……

examples.en: So, just to finish what I was saying earlier...
examples.cn: 那么，就把我刚才所说的内容讲完……

longDef.en: used as a way of making certain that you or someone else understand something correctly, often when you are repeating the important points of a plan

examples.en: So we leave on the Thursday and get back the next Tuesday, is that right?
examples.cn: 这么说，我们星期四出发，下一个星期二回来，对吗？

longDef.en: used to refer to a discovery that you have just made

examples.en: So that's what he does when I'm not around!
examples.cn: 那就是我不在的时候他所干的事！

longDef.en: used as a short pause, sometimes to emphasize what you are saying
longDef.cn: （表示停顿，有时用于强调所说的内容）

examples.en: So, here we are again - just you and me.
examples.cn: 瞧，我们又在一起了——就你和我。

longDef.en: used before you introduce a subject of conversation that is of present interest, especially when you are asking a question
longDef.cn: （表示引出谈话内容，尤用于提问）那么

examples.en: So, who do you think is going to win the election?
examples.cn: 那么，你认为谁会赢得大选？

longDef.en: used to show that you agree with something that someone has just said, but you do not think that it is important
longDef.cn: （表示某人所说的内容并不重要）是呀，没错

examples.en: So the car's expensive - well, I can afford it.
examples.cn: 没错，这辆车的确很贵——可我买得起。

longDef.en: and for that reason; therefore

examples.en: My knee started hurting so I stopped running.
examples.cn: 我的膝盖开始疼痛，因此我停下来不再跑了。

examples.en: I was lost so I bought a street map.
examples.cn: 我迷路了，所以买了一张街道地图。

longDef.en: used before you give an explanation for the action that you have just mentioned

examples.en: I deliberately didn't have lunch so (that) I would be hungry tonight.
examples.cn: 我特意没吃午饭，为的就是让自己今晚能感到饿。

examples.en: Leave the keys out so (that) I remember to take them with me.
examples.cn: 把钥匙放在外面，好让我记得带。

longDef.en: in order to

examples.en: I always keep fruit in the fridge so as to keep flies off it.
examples.cn: 我总是把水果放在冰箱里，以防虫子叮咬。

longDef.en: in order not to

examples.en: He did not switch on the light so as not to disturb her.
examples.cn: 为了不打扰她，他没有开灯。

longDef.en: perfectly tidy and well arranged
longDef.cn: 非常整齐的，井井有条的

examples.en: He's a perfectionist - everything has to be just so.
examples.cn: 他是个完美主义者——一切都必须是一丝不乱的。

longDef.en:
the musical note 
soh
longDef.cn: 索（大调音阶的第五音，同 soh）
